Reference expression datasets metadata

reference_expression_datasets.Rd

Metadata table describing the available reference expression datasets in the perturbplan package. This table maps biological systems to their corresponding data processing configurations and functions.

Usage

reference_expression_datasets

Format

A data frame with 6 rows and 4 columns:

cell_type

Character. The biological system name (K562, THP-1, T_CD8, A549, iPSC, iPSC_neuron)

platform

Character. The experimental platform used (all "10x" for 10x Chromium)

config_name

Character. Configuration variable name for data source paths

process_function

Character. Name of the processing function for each dataset

Source

Internal metadata for perturbplan package data management.

Details

This metadata table is used internally by get_pilot_data_from_package to map biological system names to their corresponding data objects and processing functions. Each row represents one supported biological system:

  • K562: Chronic myelogenous leukemia cells

  • THP-1: Monocytic leukemia cells

  • T_CD8: Primary CD8+ T cells

  • A549: Lung adenocarcinoma cells

  • iPSC: Induced pluripotent stem cells

See also

get_pilot_data_from_package for using this metadata to access pilot data

Examples

# Load metadata
data(reference_expression_datasets)
print(reference_expression_datasets)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 4
#>   cell_type   platform config_name                             process_function 
#>   <chr>       <chr>    <chr>                                   <chr>            
#> 1 K562        10x      LOCAL_GASPERINI_2019_SRA_DATA_DIR       process_k562_10x 
#> 2 THP-1       10x      LOCAL_YAO_2023_DATA_DIR                 process_thp1_10x 
#> 3 T_CD8       10x      LOCAL_SHIFRUT_2018_DATA_DIR             process_t_cd8_10x
#> 4 A549        10x      LOCAL_SAKELLAROPOULOS_2024_RAW_DATA_DIR process_a549_10x 
#> 5 iPSC        10x      LOCAL_TIAN_2019_RAW_DATA_DIR_1          process_ipsc_10x 
#> 6 iPSC_neuron 10x      LOCAL_TIAN_2019_RAW_DATA_DIR_2          process_ipsc_neu…

# View available biological systems
available_systems <- reference_expression_datasets$cell_type
print(available_systems)
#> [1] "K562"        "THP-1"       "T_CD8"       "A549"        "iPSC"       
#> [6] "iPSC_neuron"
